required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of Efficacy and Safety of a 60-day Use of the Magnox Comfort Compared to the Placebo in Subjects With NLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Prospective, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Clinical Trial in the Parallel Groups to Determine the Efficacy and Safety of a 60-day Use of the Magnox Comfort Compared to the Placebo in Subjects With NLC

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, multicenter, prospective, double-blind, placebo-controlled, clinical trial in the parallel groups to determine the efficacy and safety of a 60-day use of the dietary supplement Magnox Comfort compared to the placebo in subjects with nocturnal legs cramps

detailed_description.textblock: At the beginning of the study, study subjects undergo a 14-day screening period during which the number of episodes of NLC is recorded. For further participation in the study, they must have at least 4 NLC episodes. Thereafter, an examination of compliance with the study requirements is performed and study subjects are randomized to one of the two groups: for a 60-day of IP use (1 capsule of Magnox Comfort daily) or to the control group (1 capsule of placebo daily).

primary_outcome.measure: The number of episodes of NLC
primary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in count of nocturnal legs cramps documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.
primary_outcome.description: The study subject will record the number of episodes of nocturnal legs cramps in the study subject's diary

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in duration of nocturnal legs cramps documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.
secondary_outcome.description: The study subject will record the length of cramps in the diary

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of pain associated with NLC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in severity of pain of nocturnal legs cramps documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.
secondary_outcome.description: The study subject will record the severity of cramps in the diary using the visual analog scale from 0 to 10

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in quality of life documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.
secondary_outcome.description: Study Short Form 36 Health Survey (SF-36) is one of the most widely used universal HRQoL scales, and it is widely used in the HRQoL measurement of general population, evaluation of clinical trials and health policy evaluation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in sleep quality documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.
secondary_outcome.description: The evaluation will be conducted using VAS (visual analog scale) from 0 to 5

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The difference in drop-out rate documented in the trial, as compared between the study product and the placebo treated individuals, during a treatment period of 60-day.

arm_group.description: 80 subjects will be on the Magnox Comfort arm.
80 subjects will be on the Placebo arm.

intervention.description: Magnox Comfort (Magnesium (226 mg in equivalent), Vitamin E - 45 mg, Vitamin B6 - 2 mg.).
